author: craigmcc
msg: Revised patch -- as Alec pointed out, the "simplistic" patch I entered first
will fail to find any parameter values when calling the
request.getParameterValues() method with a name that has already been
stripped.
Also, added some Javadoc comments to clarify that if you specify both a prefix
and a suffix, BOTH must be present to match, and information about how the
setter method for each property is actually identified.

author: craigmcc
msg: Correctly handle the stripping of prefixes and suffixes from parameter
names.  This patch is slightly simpler than the one submitted by Alec Bau
<Alec.Bau@msdw.com>, and covers the case where both prefix and suffix are
specified.

author: craigmcc
msg: Implement the more refined list of exceptions that can be thrown by the
various BeanUtils methods related to property lookups via reflection, and
take advantage of these refinements to improve the exceptions thrown by
the custom tags that perform property lookups.
Submitted by:	Chris Audley <CAudley@urbanfetch.com>

author: craigmcc
msg: The "getter.result" message requires two arguments, not one.
Submitted by:	Chris Audley <CAudley@urbanfetch.com>

author: craigmcc
msg: Do not wipe out the body text if attributeName is non-null.  It will have
been set properly in the begin() method.
Submitted by:	Arno Schumacher <arno.schumacher@brokat.com
